quizzes.title: History Quiz: Women and Men
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, geichas, bodice. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In ancient Japan geichas were famous for their fashion coiffures. However, it was difficult to preserve them during sleep. Still they managed to keep their complex hairdos. How?

options.text: Using pillows filled with buckwheat chaff

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Using pillows filled with buckwheat chaff

questions.question: This chocolate flavored milk drink, test-marketed by Nestle in 2002, was an utter failure.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Choglit

questions.question: The Edsel was a terrible dud for Ford Motor Co. How was the name derived?

options.text: It was the name of  Henry Fords first grandchild.
It was the maiden name of Henry Fords first wife.
It was the name of one of Henry Fords sons
It was the maiden name of Henry Fords second wife.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was the name of one of Henry Fords sons

questions.question: Who was the first woman said to wear trousers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sarah Bernhardt

questions.question: The first bodice was invented not to dress women, but to make them more attractive to men by pushing breast up and out. Where was it invented?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On the island of Crete

questions.question: Who were first to wear something like mens underwear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egyptians

questions.question: He was an otherwise great inventor but his car was a total flop. It featured a gas gauge that made a loud  whistle when the gas supply was low. Who was this inventor of the vacuum tube, an invention that led to the development of radio?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lee Deforest

questions.question: When did the term milliner appear for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In 1529

questions.question: Who introduced the pollover sweater?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coco Channel

questions.question: What did rich Egyptian women place on top of their heads and kept it there all day?

options.text: A jewel made of serpents skin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A cone of scented grease

questions.question: Roman women were jealous of the captive-women from the German tribes that their men captured. That is why they used to cut off the captives long blond braids and used them as this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Part of their own hair

questions.question: In order  to get the  Generation-X car buyers, this cross-over SUV was made by GM from 2001-2005. It was a financial failure.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pontiac Aztek

questions.question: It  was still the custom in the 1960s for  many people to not eat meat on Fridays. McDonalds could not stand to lose these customers on Friday so this product was developed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hula Burger

questions.question: Besides white, what two colors were popular for a wedding dress a few centuries ago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue and pink

questions.question: When was the first pull-on mens underwear invented ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Around 13th century

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Movie and Civilizations
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, stars, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Ixtab, wife of Chamer was the Maya goddess of this, regarded as an honor by the Mayan people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Suicide

questions.question: In the 4th century, the Mayas were among the first civilizations to use what in their counting system?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The number zero

questions.question: This movie featured two of the biggest stars of 1986. They were a married couple form 1985-1989. George Harrison also appeared in the movie. Although the movie was beautifully filmed, it was a critical and financial flop.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shanghai Surprise

questions.question: The Mayan language is still alive and spoken by about 300,000 people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In Mesoamerican chronology, this period of time is dubbed Classic Era, and marks the peak of the cities of the Maya southern lowlands.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 300 AD - 900 AD

questions.question: Due to the lack of natural resources, the Mayans were not familiar with this material, which helped in the advancement of many other civilizations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iron

questions.question: Which of these is the most recognizable feature of Maya architecture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Giant stepped pyramids

questions.question: Maya ritual ceremonies were particularly noted for which one of these reasons?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cruel sacrifices

questions.question: Mayas used a special kind of shorthand for easier counting, which consisted of these three main symbols.

options.text: Empty circle, filled circle and dot

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ellipse, dot and bar

questions.question: Panasonic developed the VHS type of tape and Sony developed this type.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: BetaMax

questions.question: Geographically, Mayan cities were mainly situated in which of these locations?

options.text: The central parts of South America
The West coast of North America

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Central America

questions.question: Water World and The Postman were two of the biggest flops in movie history. Who was the star of both of these films?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kevin Costner

questions.question: Funky Fries was a brand name of frozen French Fries developed by the Ore-Ida subsidy of Heinz Foods. Which of the following was not a flavor of Funky Fries?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Strawberry

questions.question: He was an important inventor and a much criticized teacher. When he tried to invent a plane, it looked like a flying bee-hive and did not perform well. Who was this man who wanted a law to ban deaf people from marrying?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander Graham Bell

questions.question: Classic Maya kings carried this title, meaning supreme and sacred ruler.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: K’ul ahau

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Result and Period
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, iraq, summer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: 1981 marked the launch of this first spaceworthy NASA shuttle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Columbia

questions.question: United Nations, known initially as United Nations Organization, was founded as a result of the Yalta Conference, which took place on what date?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4 to 11 February 1945

questions.question: “Sitzkrieg” is a term referring to the first period of WW II that lasted until May 1940. This period is also known as what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phony War

questions.question: Some academics consider World War I and II as two major parts of a single conflict. How many years apart were the two wars?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 21

questions.question: 1987 brought this black day for the US stock market.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monday

questions.question: Who was shot and killed at Manila airport, the Phillippines in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Benigno Aquino, Jr.

questions.question: What countrys civilian airliner was shot down by a Russian fighter jet in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Korea

questions.question: During World War II, apart from concentration and labor camps, there were extermination camps, also known as Death Camps. What was the number of the major death camps, built for the purposes of the Holocaust?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: 1982 saw the murders associated with this over-the-counter drug.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tylenol

questions.question: In 1989 this actress, in partnership with the Ameritech Pension fund, purchased the town of Braselton, GA for $20 million.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kim Baysinger

questions.question: What Turkish assassin shot and wounded Pope John Paul II in 1981?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mehmet Ali Agca

questions.question: The Battle of Normandy, also known as Operation Overlord, was the largest sea borne invasion of World War II.  Operation Overlord started with D-Day on 6 June 1944. What does the “D” in D-Day stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Day

questions.question: This city was elected to host the 1984 summer Olympics without a vote -- it was the only city to submit a bid.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Los Angeles

questions.question: Which of the following was NOT a result of the failed attempt to rescue American hostages during the Iran hostage crisis of 1980?

options.text: The formation of U.S. Army’s 160th Special Operations Aviation Regiment
The relocation of the US Embassy in Iran
The creation of  US Special Operations Command (USSOCOM)
The plan for a second rescue mission, Operation Credible Sport

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The relocation of the US Embassy in Iran

questions.question: Iran invaded Iraq on 22 September, 1980.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Country and Japan
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, fronts. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which nation revolted against Soviet-imposed policies in 1956?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hungary

questions.question: After the end of World War II, the European Recovery Plan (Recovery Plan for the reconstruction of Europe) was created. It was established by US Secretary of State George Marshall and is better known as The Marshall Plan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which Central European country fought alongside the Allies on all European and African fronts during WW II and was left on the eastern side of the curtain at the Yalta Conference?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: On 11 December 1941, Germany declared war on the United States, hoping that Japan would consecutively support the attack on the Soviet Union.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When did the Berlin Wall fall, ending symbolically the Cold War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1989

questions.question: In which country did the Solidarność (Solidarity) movement start?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: Which country was divided into East and West during the Cold War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Germany

questions.question: Which country was invaded by the Soviet Army in 1968?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Czechoslovakia

questions.question: China and The United States officially declared war on Japan, how many days after the attack on Pearl Harbor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One

questions.question: Which freedom movement leader was also a writer and dramatist?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vaclav Havel

questions.question: During World War II, resistance was formed in every occupied country. What was the name of the resistance movement that the British were preparing, in case the country was occupied?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Auxiliary Units

questions.question: Which Pope was credited with igniting the freedom movement in Poland and eventually in the whole Eastern European region?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Paul II

questions.question: What were the nicknames of the two atomic bombs dropped over Japan on 6 August 1945 and 9 August 1945?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Boy and Fat Man

questions.question: What was the name of the organization of Central and Eastern European communist states, established as a counterweight against NATO?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Warsaw Pact

questions.question: Which nations catholic bishops issued the famous letter to their German counterparts, in which they forgave and asked for forgiveness?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Che Guevara and Group
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, _____, che. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Che Guevara was a Marxist revolutionary, who took part in the Cuban Revolution under the command of Fidel Castro. Where did Che Guevara die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bolivia

questions.question: What is the only tank battle fought during the so called Winter War (1939-1940)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Honkaniemi

questions.question: One of the events that led to the American Revolution was the Boston Tea Party. On 16 December 1773 a group of Boston residents (the group was called Sons of Liberty) destroyed the cargo of three British ships. Which one of these men didnt take part in the event?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Samuel Graves

questions.question: The Great Cultural Revolution was a revolutionary uprising of students and workers in China, led by Mao Zedong. It officially ended in 1969, but there are statements that this period continued up until the arrest of the Gang Of Four. One of the founding members of the gang was Maos ____
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: wife

questions.question: What prominent figure in Nazi Germany was Adolf Hitlers deputy in the Nazi Party?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rudolph Hess

questions.question: What effective submachine gun was also known as the Schmeisser?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: MP40

questions.question: Rosa Luxemburg and Karl Liebknecht took part in the German Revolution of 1919.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The second stage of the Russian Revolution of 1917 was the October Revolution, the first communist revolution of the 20th century. This revolutionary led the assault on the Winter Palace.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vladimir Antonov-Ovseenko

questions.question: The French Revolution began in 1789 with the storming of this building and ended in 1799 after succeeding to overthrow the absolute monarchy in France.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bastille prison

questions.question: The Romanian Revolution of 1989 was a series of violent riots and protests. It aimed at overthrowing of the Communist regime of Nicolae Ceausescu. What was the name of Ceausescus wife, later executed together with her husband?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elena

questions.question: Which of these dictators was the last to die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francisco Franco

questions.question: This rebellion broke in 1857 in _____, fighting against the British colonial control over the country. It is sometimes referred to as the Sepoy Mutiny or the Sepoy Rebellion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: On 23 July 1961 the Sandinista National Liberation Front was organized in Nicaragua. This marked the beginning of the fight against the dictatorship of this family and led to the Nicaraguan Revolution.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Somoza

questions.question: On December 7, 1942 the Japanese attacked Pearl Harbor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the beginning of the 19th century, Simon Bolivar fought for the independence of countries like Venezuela, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, Panama and Bolivia. On 24 July 1983 this man founded the Movimiento Bolivariano Revolucionario 200 in Venezuela and 15 years later, became president.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hugo Chavez

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Flop and Time
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, bette, signs. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In what year was the first microwave oven manufactured by Tappan and offered in the USA for $1300.00?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1955

questions.question: Which ruler was crowned the first Tsar of All the Russias?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ivan the Terrible

questions.question: By the time Nicholas II was crowned tsar in 1896, the Russian Empire was the largest country in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these was NOT a Broadway flop?

options.text: Teaneck Tanzi: The Venus Fly Trap (1983)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Medusa (1981)

questions.question: Who was the first Russian tsar of the Romanov dynasty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael

questions.question: A musical version of Carrie, the Stephen King story, was a huge flop on Broadway.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The average income in the United States in 1952 was $3,515.00. What was the average price of a house at that time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: $16,800.00

questions.question: The song American Pie by Don McLean concerns a plane crash which took place on February 3, 1959.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who was Empress of Russia from 1741 to 1762?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elizabeth

questions.question: In 1991 Pfizer came out with the medicine Sildenafil, designed to stop angina pectoris. It was a flop as it had little effect on angina. What was good about this medicine?

options.text: It lead to the development of Oxycontin.
It was an inexpensive medicine that could lower LDL cholesterol.
It was an inexpensive medicine that could lower HDL cholesterol.
It lead to the development of Viagra.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It lead to the development of Viagra.

questions.question: Which Russian Empress brought Rasputin into the center of the Imperial court?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexandra

questions.question: What was Tsarskoye Selo?

options.text: The residence of the imperial family south of St. Petersburg
The site of a famous Russian battle
The true last name of the members of the Romanov dynasty

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The residence of the imperial family south of St. Petersburg

questions.question: In 1956 Bette Nesmith Graham invented Mistake Out which later became known by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Liquid Paper

questions.question: What American product from the 50s was advertised with roadside signs reading slogans such as:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burma Shave

questions.question: What city was the Russian capital before Tsar Peter the Great founded St. Petersburg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Moscow
